p_1.title: Trinity Street, Norwich
p_1.description: A clean simple hand made kitchen, in Farrow and Ball “All White” with an American white oak worktop. Given a modern twist with a stainless steel butler sink, this sits perfectly in a modern extension to a period house.

p_3.title: Ipswich Road, Norwich
p_3.description: A contemporary design, using a flat panel door and discreet shadow gap details. We offered the customer some bespoke handles made to the customers own design at no charge

p_4.title: Essex Street, Norwich
p_4.description: A bookcase and cupboard arrangement, with internal drawers for the customers coin collection.

p_5.title: Unthank Road, Norwich
p_5.description: A straightforward run of framed wardrobes, that sit perfectly in a victorian house on unthank road.

p_8.title: West Church St, Kenninghall
p_8.description: Working closely with the client on the design, we managed to create a truly stunning kitchen with beautiful curves. Painted in Dulux Heritage 'green earth' with a American white oak worktop.

p_9.title: Frostenden Corner, Suffolk
p_9.description: This 250 year old cottage required a traditional looking kitchen, the 2 ½ inch European Oak worktop gave it immense warmth, and the pale blue knotty tongue and groove doors added character and charm.

p_10.title: Trix Road, Norwich
p_10.description: Three Alcove Cupboards Painted in Farrow and Ball "All White", with raised and fielded panel doors, reed details and adjustable shelving.

p_11.title: Christchurch Road
p_11.description: A matching hallway cupboard and bookcase in the Clients own Art Deco design made this a very special piece. Crafted in solid American Walnut then oiled and waxed giving the piece a truly stunning finish. Drawers in solid walnut on invisible soft closing runners.

p_12.title: Kintbury
p_12.description: A Georgian styled kitchen, with plain mouldings and mortise and tenon doors hung on butt hinges, fitted using traditional methods.  The tall wall cupboards gave the clients a huge amount of storage, and the European oak worktops were handmade from super wide (8") planks of quarter sawn timber, then oiled and waxed.

p_14.title: Thorpe St Andrew
p_14.description: A traditionaly styled set of wardrobes, painted in Farrow and Balls "White Tie".

p_16.title: Trinity Street, Norwich
p_16.description: A stunning Art Deco design, combining the timeless beauty of walnut with contrasting grey cupboards.

p_18.title: Unthank Road, Norwich
p_18.description: Using handmade Iroko worktops brought real warmth into this 3 sided kitchen, and the island provided even more worktop space.

p_19.title: Poringland
p_19.description: Wall to wall, floor to ceiling cupbords in European Oak and oak veneer. Soild wood shelves with adjustable shelving fitted around a plasma TV gave this occasional lounge real warmth. The customer was so happy he then ordered a matching Coffee Table / Blanket Box. He was so happy with that - he then placed an order for the other end of the room to receive matching cupboards!

p_20.title: London
p_20.description: A bespoke Kitchen, painted in a lovely heritage green with beautiful oak worktops, plenty of dovetailed drawers and tons of spave in the alocove cupbaords.

p_22.title: Unthank Road
p_22.description: A complete set of bedroom furniture, wardrobes, bedside cupbaords and even a pop-up plasma surround. Oh - did we not mention the kitchen in the wardrobe!? All made from European Walnut.

p_23.title: Thurlton
p_23.description: Two rooms, one in a white painted traditional styled country design, with wardrobes, bedsides and overmantle. The other, a more elaborate affair. A long run of solid oak wardrobes, with cockbeading around the frame, raised and fielded panel doors and scribed plinth and cornice.

p_27.title: Wortwell, Norfolk
p_27.description: A special project, this involved designing two sideboards that could house some old sentimental books but then be able to push together to form a large 12 seater table. We then personilised the piece further and carved the customers family members on the bottom rail.

p_28.title: Essex Street, Norwich
p_28.description: Oak and stone worktops, and cupboards painted in "Lamp Room Grey"
